message: I am also looking at hosted services like Optimizely (http://www.optimizely.com), and am wondering if that would be better than a server-side approach.

I don't know enough about split testing yet to compare Django-AB (https://github.com/johnboxall/django-ab) and Django-Lean (http://pypi.python.org/pypi/django-lean) on their merits, so would appreciate any advice and guidance. What are their comparative strengths and weaknesses?
OK, just came across another entrant, called Splango: https://github.com/shimon/Splango

webmaven: I wrote Splango, so I'm not impartial... but I did write it instead of using django-ab largely because I wanted to be able to do multivariate (not just test/control) tests and to be able to set up an experiment in both python and django template code. I'd be delighted if you or anyone else were to give it a try, happy to help with fixes/improvements as needed.
actually, what I looked at previously was django-lean. django-ab looks OK but mainly oriented toward testing different template files.

@shimon, OK, Splango sounds attractive. The README is intruiging, if a bit short on details. Can I log the goal from a template? I'd also like to hear more about how Splango supports multivariate analysis, and if you think there are circumstances where django-lean would be better suited.
